DialogueOption.Text: I found a hidden planet!
I found out something new about the Stranger.
Feldspar's alive!

Dialogue.Page: Whoa! Really? That's incredible! Where are they hiding, then?

DialogueOption.Text: They're in Dark Bramble, living inside an anglerfish skeleton.

Dialogue.Page: Ah… the one place nobody would ever check, right? Makes sense. I'm glad to see that they're alive!
Whoa! Huh, I guess that anomaly Hornfels sent me out to investigate was a real anomaly after all!
Well, never let it be said that I can't admit when I'm wrong. Especially when being wrong means something so cool!
And you call it “The Stranger”, huh… well, I'm hooked! Come on, time bud, tell me more!
Ooh! Lay it on me, bud!

DialogueOption.Text: It's a ring world! It's just one big loop!
The aliens that lived in it look really… weird.
Its inhabitants had some ties to the Eye of the Universe.
I found this thing inside it.
Its inhabitants have access to some kind of… dream world. I've been there.
The dream world is actually a computer simulation.
I found a prisoner of theirs locked up in the dream world.
I found a friendly inhabitant in the dream world through a fire in Dark Bramble.
I think I committed murder by blowing out one of their flames.
Nevermind, sorry.

Dialogue.Page: Anything else?

DialogueOption.Text: It's a ring world! It's just one big loop!
The aliens that lived in it look really… weird.
Its inhabitants had some ties to the Eye of the Universe.
I found this thing inside it.
Its inhabitants have access to some kind of… dream world. I've been there.
The dream world is actually a computer simulation.
I found a prisoner of theirs locked up in the dream world.
I found a friendly inhabitant in the dream world through a fire in Dark Bramble.
I think I committed murder by blowing out one of their flames.
That's actually all I know…

Dialogue.Page: Well, there's only one way to go fix that, pal. Go out there and check it out some more! Come on, what've you got to be afraid of?
That's alright. Let me know when you find something cool, though. You know where to find me.
A ring world, huh… imagine being able to look up and see the other side of the world.
Sounds kind of terrifying, honestly. You wouldn't be able to have any privacy. People could always see where you are all the time…
Heh… fitting that it'd be in a loop of all shapes.
Hmm… big antlers like the Nomai, but with… weird fuzz on their bodies? Like… fluffy scales? Wow, that's weird weird!
Honestly, it kind of makes me want to go out and pet one of them. …Assuming they're friendly, of course.
Did they now? I'll be honest, that's never really been my area of expertise. I don't know much about it other than that the Nomai were looking for it.
And… I guess now we can probably say they were looking for it, too. I wonder if any other alien races came looking after the Eye? Did any of them ever find it?
Mmm. I think you've given me a lot to consider with that one, time bud.
Mmm… interesting. I'm no archaeologist, but that kind of looks like a lantern of some kind.
No idea how it would burn, though. Maybe you need some special alien lantern oil… or some kind of special alien flame.
Something to look into, I guess.
A… dream world? Gosh, the more you tell me about this place the more I want to go there! So all the Stranger's inhabitants aren't actually dead, they're just living in some dream world…
I wonder how that works. I mean, I've never been one to believe in magic… but that really sounds like magic to me.
Well, I'm looking forward to when you get to the bottom of it.
Oh! Yeah, that makes sense. I mean, more sense than it being magic, anyways.
That's a lot of effort to go through, though. I guess they really missed their old home. Or maybe they wanted to be immortal? Maybe both.
…Mmm. I feel bad for them. I can't imagine being locked up for Hearth-knows-how-long with nobody to talk to and nothing to do.
I guess this time loop is its own sort of prison, but at least we're not alone, right? That prisoner guy, they had no-one at all…
Ah… ahem. Sorry, just got kind of emotional about that for some reason. I'm glad you let them out. Even if it was just for one loop.
Whoa! They set stuff up on Dark Bramble, too? I always thought those wooden structures were just built by the Nomai using the resources they had around them.
It's fortunate that they spoke Nomai. Probably good that you went and talked to them; poor guy probably hasn't talked to anyone new in millenia!
Oh, that's… not great.
I mean, I guess it's fine since they just come right back after the loop? Still, that's kind of messed up…

Dang, I get the feeling there's a deep geyser hole we could go down about whether one's actions still have morality attached to them in a scenario where neither consequences nor memory persist after the fact.
But that's probably a discussion to be had with someone smarter than me.
